section.title: Download and Install JBoss Application Server 7

listitem.para: Install JBoss AS into a directory that does not have any spaces in its path.
Test the installation by starting the default configuration installation.
listitem.programlisting:
$ jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/bin/bin/standalone.sh user@ubuntu:/opt$ ./jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/bin/standalone.sh =========================================================================
JBoss Bootstrap Environment
JBOSS_HOME: /opt/jboss-as-7.1.1.Final
JAVA: java
JAVA_OPTS: -server -XX:+TieredCompilation -Xms64m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Dorg.jboss.resolver.warning=true -Dsun.rmi.dgc.client.gcInterval=3600000 -Dsun.rmi.dgc.server.gcInterval=3600000 -Djboss.modules.system.pkgs=org.jboss.byteman -Djava.awt.headless=true -Djboss.server.default.config=standalone.xml
=========================================================================

listitem.para: Verify you can access the server
Admin Page:http://localhost:9990/console This will fail until the admin account is added.
Make a copy of the standalone.xml and use it as a backup

note.para: The instructions state to backup the original and edit the default server. We could have also chosen to make a copy of the default server and edit one by a new name. In the later case, we would need to add "-c copyof-standalone.xml" to the startup command to point to the non-default server from the command line. I have found that option to confuse some of the tool integration.

listitem.para: Add a logger for the class examples so the server prints debug messages to the logs. The ejava logger is for the class examples. The jhu logger is for student projects. Your java packages should start with jhu.xxx to make this work easily.
Use the batch script to add an admin user to the system.
listitem.programlisting:
user@ubuntu:/opt$ ./jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/bin/add-user.sh

listitem.para: Retry logging into the Admin Application http://localhost:9990/console

section.title: Enable JBoss Remote Debugging
section.para: Prepare your server for remote debugging for later.

listitem.para: Uncomment the following line in either bin/standalone.conf (Linux) or bin/standalone.conf.bat (Windows)
listitem.programlisting: # Sample JPDA settings for remote socket debugging JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS -Xrunjdwp:transport=dt_socket,address=8787,server=y,suspend=n"

listitem.para: Restart the server and notice the additional listen output. Use control-C to stop the server.
listitem.programlisting:
$ ./jboss-as-7.1.1.Final/bin/standalone.sh ========================================================================= ...
Listening for transport dt_socket at address: 8787 23:01:50,460 INFO [org.jboss.modules] JBoss Modules version 1.1.1.GA 23:01:51,688 INFO [org.jboss.msc] JBoss MSC version 1.0.2.GA

listitem.para: If you already have a process listening on 8080 or any of the other JBoss ports on 127.0.0.1, you can switch addresses by editing the interfaces section of standandalone.xml. You can also do this at runtime by adding -Djboss.bind.address.management=... and/or -Djboss.bind.address=... on the command line.

section.title: Define JBoss Maven Properties in settings.xml

listitem.para: Provide a specification to maven where your JBoss server has been installed in the .m2/settings.xml file using the jboss.home property. If you have changed the address -- you can specify that using the jboss.host property.
